title: How to Make a Vanilla and Coffee Marble Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Spray a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan.
Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar in a separate large bowl using a hand mixer or electric blender.
steps.description: Cream until the mixture is light and fluffy, which should take about five minutes.

steps.headline: Add the eggs and vanilla.
steps.description: Crack in the eggs, one at a time. Pour in the vanilla extract. Mix.

steps.headline: Add the flour mixture and yogurt.
steps.description: Pour in only half of the flour mixture. Blend on low speed and then carefully scrape in the yogurt. Add the rest of the flour mixture and blend until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Separate the batter into two bowls.
Add the ground coffee and boiling water and add it to the first bowl.
steps.description: Mix until well-combined. Stir in the cocoa powder and mix again.

steps.headline: Spread both batters into the loaf pan.
steps.description: Use a knife to swirl the batter into a "marbled" look.

steps.headline: Bake the coffee cake for about 40-50 minutes, until the cake fully bakes.
Remove the cake from the oven allow it cool for about ten minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Cut a slice of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Spray a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan.  Mix the dry ingredients. In a medium-sized bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Cream the butter and sugar in a separate large bowl using a hand mixer or electric blender. Cream until the mixture is light and fluffy, which should take about five minutes. Add the eggs and vanilla. Crack in the eggs, one at a time. Pour in the vanilla extract. Mix. Add the flour mixture and yogurt. Pour in only half of the flour mixture. Blend on low speed and then carefully scrape in the yogurt. Add the rest of the flour mixture and blend until there are no more flour streaks. Separate the batter into two bowls.  Add the ground coffee and boiling water and add it to the first bowl. Mix until well-combined. Stir in the cocoa powder and mix again. Spread both batters into the loaf pan. Use a knife to swirl the batter into a "marbled" look. Bake the coffee cake for about 40-50 minutes, until the cake fully bakes.  Remove the cake from the oven allow it cool for about ten minutes.  Serve. Cut a slice of cake and lay it on a serving plate. Enjoy!
sentences: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Spray a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan.
Mix the dry ingredients.
In a medium-sized bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Cream the butter and sugar in a separate large bowl using a hand mixer or electric blender.
Cream until the mixture is light and fluffy, which should take about five minutes.
Add the eggs and vanilla.
Crack in the eggs, one at a time.
Pour in the vanilla extract.
Mix.
Add the flour mixture and yogurt.
Pour in only half of the flour mixture.
Blend on low speed and then carefully scrape in the yogurt.
Add the rest of the flour mixture and blend until there are no more flour streaks.
Separate the batter into two bowls.
Add the ground coffee and boiling water and add it to the first bowl.
Mix until well-combined.
Stir in the cocoa powder and mix again.
Spread both batters into the loaf pan.
Use a knife to swirl the batter into a "marbled" look.
Bake the coffee cake for about 40-50 minutes, until the cake fully bakes.
Remove the cake from the oven allow it cool for about ten minutes.
Serve.
Cut a slice of cake and lay it on a serving plate.
Enjoy!
